item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。股市继续走高，这次是在中国刺激计划出台之后。花旗和阿波罗联手推出私人信贷。现金不断涌入货币市场基金。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. Stocks keep going higher — this time in the wake of China stimulus plans. Citi and Apollo are teaming up on private credit. And cash just keeps flooding into money market funds. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 供应量有望大幅增加，石油周线深跌
item.description: 由于欧佩克（OPEC）成员国沙特阿拉伯和利比亚可能会增加供应，石油价格延续了连续两天的大幅下跌，使其有望出现连续一周的大幅下跌。【原文：Oil extended a sharp two-day drop, putting prices on course for a substantial weekly decline, on prospects of more supply from OPEC members Saudi Arabia and Libya.】

item.title: 新加坡交易所内部人士对股市复苏表示怀疑
item.description: 新加坡已开始大力重振其凋敝的股市。在其交易所运营商内部和市场参与者中间，对重启能否成功存在着深深的悲观情绪。【原文：Singapore has kicked off a big effort to revive its withering stock market. Inside its exchange operator and among market participants, there is deep pessimism that the reboot will succeed.】

item.title: 流行超市玩具助推中国消费亮点上涨 150
item.description: 对 34 岁的上海居民李美琪（Miki Li）和她的家人来说，到公寓附近的大众超市（Pop Mart）看看最新的商品已经成了周末的例行公事。【原文：Checking out the latest arrivals in a Pop Mart store near their apartment has become a weekend routine for 34-year-old Shanghai resident Miki Li and her family.】

item.title: 莫迪吸引芯片制造商，东京电子准备拓展印度市场
item.description: 东京电子有限公司（Tokyo Electron Ltd.）寻求在印度建立一支芯片工程师团队，以更好地顺应莫迪政府在世界人口最多的国家推动更多半导体制造的政策。【原文：Tokyo Electron Ltd. seeks to build a team of chip engineers in India to better ride the Modi government’s push for more semiconductor manufacturing in the world’s most populous country.】

item.title: 戴尔命令销售人员每周五天回办公室工作
item.description:
这家科技公司决定终止在家办公，而亚马逊也紧随其后下达了类似命令。【原文：

The tech company’s decision to end work from home comes on the heels of a similar order from Amazon. 

】

item.title: 中国刺激政策提振股市，股市将延续涨势：市场综述
item.description: 由于中国最新的刺激措施进一步提振了整个金融市场的风险偏好，加上美国基准股指创下新纪录，亚洲股市将延续涨势。【原文：Stocks in Asia are set to extend gains as risk appetite across financial markets got a further boost from China’s latest stimulus measures and as US benchmarks hit fresh records.】

item.title: 大卫-泰珀买下与中国有关的 "一切"，因为中国政府正在放宽政策
item.description: 在中国政府推出超出预期的大规模刺激措施后，亿万富翁投资者大卫-泰珀（David Tepper）正在购买更多与中国有关的 "一切"。【原文：Billionaire investor David Tepper is buying more of “everything” related to China after Beijing rolled out sweeping stimulus measures that exceeded expectations.】

item.title: 尽管有刺激计划，中国债券仍发出 "日本化 "警告
item.description: 中国经济面临 "日本化 "的理论推崇者看来将在债券市场上迎来一个具有象征意义的里程碑。【原文：Promoters of the theory that China faces a “Japanification” of its economy look set to enjoy a symbolic milestone in the bond market.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体联合创始人迅速行动，套现所持股份
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的电视节目《学徒》（The Apprentice）的前参赛者与他人共同创办了他的媒体初创公司，他们在禁止出售的限制解除后，毫不犹豫地抛售了公司的数百万股股份。【原文：The former contestants on Donald Trump’s TV show The Apprentice who co-founded his media startup wasted no time offloading millions of shares in the company after restrictions that prevented selling were lifted.】

item.title: DirecTV 和 Dish 接近达成合并协议
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，DirecTV 和 Dish 正在就合并事宜进行深入谈判，这项交易将创造美国最大的付费电视供应商，拥有近 2000 万用户。【原文：DirecTV and Dish are in advanced talks to merge in a deal that would create the largest US pay-TV provider, with almost 20 million subscribers, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 管道公司首席执行官：天然气需求激增，哥伦比亚陷入能源危机
item.description: 据哥伦比亚最大的管道运营商称，由于干旱导致水电供应瘫痪，进口天然气的能力也已达到极限，哥伦比亚的能源系统正处于危机之中。【原文：Colombia’s energy system is in crisis as drought cripples hydropower supplies and the capacity to import natural gas has reached its limit, according to the nation’s largest pipeline operator.】

item.title: 山姆-阿尔特曼下台近一年后加强对 OpenAI 的控制
item.description:
阿尔特曼已经超越了其他主要高管，并有望获得更大的影响力。【原文：

Altman has outlasted other key executives and is poised to gain more influence. 

】

item.title: 纽约银行获美国证券交易委员会批准开展 ETF 之外的加密货币托管业务，根斯勒说
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）表示，纽约银行梅隆公司（Bank of New York Mellon Corp.【原文：The structure Bank of New York Mellon Corp. is using to offer custody services for digital assets could be used beyond the Bitcoin and Ether exchange-traded funds that the bank is considering, according to US Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler.】

item.title: 条款收紧后 Windstream 出售 13 亿美元债务包
item.description: Windstream Holdings Inc. 出售了价值 13 亿美元的贷款和债券一揽子计划，对现有债务进行再融资。【原文：Windstream Holdings Inc. sold a $1.3 billion loan and bond package to refinance its existing debt, securing more favorable terms after the offering gained traction among investors.】

item.title: 加拿大基准股指收盘首次突破 24,000 点
item.description: 由于中国的刺激计划提振了基本金属供应商的股价，加拿大股市基准 S&P/TSX 综合指数（S&P/TSX Composite Index）周四反弹，首次收于 24,000 点以上。【原文：The S&P/TSX Composite Index, Canada’s stock market benchmark, rallied to close above 24,000 points for the first time Thursday as China’s stimulus plans boosted shares in base metal providers.】

item.title: 股市的 "金发区 "岌岌可危
item.description: Universa 投资公司（Universa Investments）创始人兼首席投资官马克-斯皮茨纳格尔（Mark Spitznagel）认为，随着股市屡创历史新高，交易商对经济软着陆的信心不断增强，股市似乎正处于 "金发区"。【原文：With equities hitting all-time highs and traders growing confident of an economic soft landing, the stock market appears to be in a “Goldilocks zone,” according to Mark Spitznagel, founder and chief investment officer of Universa Investments.】

item.title: 德拉吉苏富比拍卖行利用主权基金现金减轻债务负担
item.description: 苏富比拍卖行正计划利用阿布扎比主权财富基金主导的新投资的一部分来偿还部分现有贷款人的债务，这对债务负担沉重、销售额下滑的苏富比拍卖行来说是一条救命稻草。【原文：Sotheby’s is planning to use part of a new investment led by an Abu Dhabi sovereign wealth fund to pay back some of its existing lenders, a lifeline for the firm that has struggled with a heavy debt load and is facing a decline in sales.】

item.title: Omers 将停止在欧洲进行直接私募股权投资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，安大略省市政雇员退休系统（Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System）将停止在欧洲进行直接的私募股权投资，因为该养老基金将对其在欧洲的业务进行全面改革。【原文：The Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System will stop making direct private equity investments in Europe as the pension fund overhauls its operations there, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 大科技公司利用与共和党议员的关系阻挠儿童安全法案的通过
item.description: 众议院共和党高层正在拖延美国具有里程碑意义的保护儿童免受网络剥削和欺凌的立法，向大科技公司的批评低头，并暴露了党内在监管社交媒体问题上的裂痕。【原文：Top House Republicans are stalling landmark US legislation that would protect children from online exploitation and bullying, bowing to criticisms from Big Tech and exposing a rift within the party over regulating social media.】

item.title: 伯恩斯坦称，新任首席执行官上任后星巴克仍有上升空间
item.description: 随着布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）被任命为首席执行官，星巴克公司的股价飙升，使人们对这家咖啡制造商的转机感到乐观。伯恩斯坦公司的分析师预测，未来还会有更多的变化。【原文：Starbucks Corp. shares soared with the appointment of Brian Niccol as chief executive officer boosting optimism over an about-turn for the coffee maker. Bernstein analysts predict there’s more to come.】

item.title: 米莱紧缩政策重创阿根廷，贫困率飙升至 50
item.description: 今年上半年，随着哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）总统推出休克疗法计划，阿根廷的贫困率达到了自 2001 年金融危机以来的最高水平，目的是让本已衰退的经济重新站起来。【原文：Poverty in Argentina reached its highest level since the aftermath of the 2001 financial crisis in the first half of the year, as President Javier Milei unleashed a shock therapy program to put an already reeling economy back on its feet.】

item.title: Zip 公司飙升 937% 位居全球支付类股之首，美国前景看好
item.description: 澳大利亚 Zip 公司已成为过去一年中全球表现最好的数字支付股票，因为交易员们寄希望于降息和控制成本能促进其美国业务的发展。【原文：Australia’s Zip Co. has become the best performing digital payments stock in the world over the past year as traders wager on a boost for its US business from interest-rate cuts and a focus on curbing costs.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行鹰派的利率路径让布洛克在世界经济放缓之际坐上了热搜榜
item.description: 米歇尔-布洛克（Michele Bullock）担任澳大利亚央行行长已有一年，她正面临着多方面的挑战。而且，这些不利因素很可能会愈演愈烈。【原文：A year into her term as Australia’s central bank governor, Michele Bullock is facing headwinds on multiple fronts. They’re only likely to intensify.】

item.title: 尼尔森-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）女婿退出特里安公司后将寻求激进资金
item.description: 在离开与岳父纳尔逊-佩尔茨（Nelson Peltz）共同创办的激进主义公司一年多后，埃德-加登正准备管理外部资本。【原文：Ed Garden is preparing to manage outside capital more than a year after leaving the activist firm he co-founded with his father-in-law, Nelson Peltz.】

item.title: Carahsoft 老板在联邦调查局突袭前靠政府销售建立帝国
item.description: 四年前，SAP SE 高管马克-特斯托尼（Mark Testoni）和大型软件转售商 Carahsoft Technology Corp. 的总裁兼创始人克雷格-阿博德（Craig Abod）站在卓越销售协会（Institute for Excellence in Sales）组织的一次活动的讲台上。【原文：Four years ago, Mark Testoni, an SAP SE executive, and Craig Abod, the president and founder of giant software reseller Carahsoft Technology Corp., stood at the podium of an event organized by the Institute for Excellence in Sales.】

item.title: 比特币在 58 亿美元期权到期前突破 65,000 美元
item.description: 在周五期权合约到期之前，比特币在四周内首次升至 65,000 美元以上，一些分析师称，这可能会导致加密货币市场波动加剧。【原文：Bitcoin rose above $65,000 for the first time in four weeks before the expiration of options contracts on Friday that some analysts say may result in heightened volatility in the cryptocurrency market.】

item.title: 高盛集团的鲁布纳认为大选后 "买入中国 "的贸易游戏将上演
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）全球市场董事总经理兼战术专家斯科特-鲁布纳（Scott Rubner）表示，中国股市一路高歌猛进，纳斯达克金龙指数（Nasdaq Golden Dragon Index）在过去四天内飙升了 19%，美国大选结束后，中国股市应成为投资者计划中的关键部分。【原文：Chinese stocks have been on a tear, with the Nasdaq Golden Dragon Index soaring 19% in the last four days, and the shares should be a key part of investors’ plans once the US election is over, according to Scott Rubner, managing director for global markets and tactical specialist at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 欧洲央行施纳贝尔称欧元区经济停滞，通货紧缩有望缓解
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔似乎对欧元区经济更加担忧。【原文：European Central Bank Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel appears to have become more concerned about the euro-zone economy.】
